drupalNodeEvent.title: 14th All India Conference of China Studies | Chinese Influence in South Asia

field_speakers.processed: Amb. Shivshankar Menon (Ashoka University), Antara Ghosal Singh, Amish Raj Mulmi, Dr. Chulanee Attanayake (National University of Singapore), Shahtaj Mahmud (The Institute of Policy, Advocacy, and Governance, Dhaka), Dr. Constantino Xavier, Centre for Social and Economic Progress, New Delhi.

field_organizers.processed: Institute of Chinese Studies Delhi, Visva-Bharati University Santiniketan, Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung

field_description.processed: The panelists will be covering four papers on “China’s Approach to South Asia: Characteristics and Lessons”, “Charm Offensive: Shaping Chinese Perceptions in Nepal”, "China's Buddhist Influence in Sri Lanka" and “Myanmar’s Rohingya Crisis and China’s Growing Clout in Bangladesh”
